name: PoolConstruction
title: Pool Construction
description: Pool Construction codes for insurance operations.

concept.definition: Pool structure built with steel-reinforced concrete, providing durability and strength through a framework of rebar embedded in concrete.
Pool construction method using a flexible vinyl membrane as the interior surface, installed over a frame structure of steel, aluminum, or polymer.
Pre-formed pool shell manufactured from fiberglass-reinforced plastic, molded as a single piece and installed as a complete unit.
Pool construction using pneumatically applied concrete (gunite or shotcrete), sprayed at high velocity onto a rebar framework to form the pool shell.
Above-ground pool construction using corrugated or flat steel panels assembled to form the pool walls, typically with a vinyl liner interior.
Pool construction types not covered by standard categories, including hybrid materials or specialized construction methods.
